title: Font ID please.
content:
Closest I can come is Avenir...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [CCES-logo-black.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121555/http:/typophile.com/files/CCES-logo-black.jpg) | 26.63 KB |

 [‹ Need help with this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121555/http:/typophile.com/node/43326 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif that marries with Dax? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121555/http:/typophile.com/node/43310 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lapointeric

comments.content:
Interstate .

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121555/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/")

altho it looks slightly stretched.

It is actually the free rip-off [Blue Highway](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121555/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/blue-highway-deluxe/).  
I’d suggest using Interstate. It’s much better.
Thanks guys. Well done. Looks like a stretched version of Blue Highway.

don’t call a spade a spade unless it’s, well, a spade.  
i wouldn’t call BH a ripoff any more than Interstate is one.

Yeah, Paul, you’re right. My apologies to the designers of Blue Highway.  
What was the name of the original signage font? - oh yeah, Highway Gothic.  
Anyways, Interstate still is a better font.
